website_summaries.verdict: These gloves are a good choice if you're looking for sturdy, heat-resistant gloves that won't tear or absorb heat.
pros: Heat-resistant cotton interior keeps the heat from absorbing through the gloves
cons: Gloves are thick and some say inflexible
May be too large for you if you have small hands

customer_reviews.title: Fits large hand
customer_reviews.text: Just received on time as ordered. At over six foot was concerned about fit. They work. Will update if there are issues in future.
customer_reviews.author: hankmary

customer_reviews.title: Don't get burned!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for cleaning the grill and turning food over without burning your hands. I did push it a little by going a little higher than the max recommend heat range and I pulled the grate out. I was able to hold the grate for around 5 seconds or so. I recommend letting the grate cool before handling it. I felt the heat but I didn't get burned. The gloves are easy to clean with soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: TroysHobbies

customer_reviews.title: The inside of the gloves fit me fine, and I have small'ish hands (I usually wear ...
customer_reviews.text: I get what people were saying about them being on the smaller side. The inside of the gloves fit me fine, and I have small'ish hands (I usually wear a medium size glove. Sometimes large). If my hands were much larger, I doubt I would be able to get my hand in there. Size aside (since they fit me just fine), these gloves are a decent size. They go up the arm a bit, and the fingers are thicker. I've only used them a few times, but each time I could hardly tell I was digging my hands in to a steaming pile of pork, or holding a hot pan that's been in the oven all day.
customer_reviews.author: just bought this

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT protect against heat of a grill
customer_reviews.text: I love to grill and needed protection for my hands and arms from the heat of a grill. They are cute and come in great colors....they do not protect from the heat of coals. In fact, I have to say my hands felt like they were searing inside these silicone gloves. I could not get them off fast enough. Thus, the 5 stars for warmth. Your hands will cook inside these gloves. I immediately went back to my elbow- high oven gloves until I find grilling gloves that are not huge on my hands, are flexible, and can take the heat. If I could give these a minus star for barbecue gloves, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Giver

customer_reviews.title: NiCe!! They R larger than I thought wld ...
customer_reviews.text: NiCe!! They R larger than I thought wld be. Neither of our fingers go to tip but ok. Made to fit any size & they feel really good on. Inside is a soft material and when I close hand into a fist they R stretchy/soft & rn't stiff/ tough feeling. I hvent used over heat yet so im giving it a 4star but my initial reaction to them is overall a Very Nice glove & wld Deff. recommend!! Ooooh & they r extremely light weight (pic shows how thin & not bulky)
customer_reviews.author: JaN-el

customer_reviews.title: Very good for heat resistance
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very heat resistant, They are a little big for me which makes them very awkward to hold on to anything. I can pickup meat, probes, and probably just about anything else straight off the grill or smoker and not feel any heat at all. Easy to clean, just wear them and wash your hand with them on. They say they are machine washable, but I have not tried that yet. They look they are reversible also.
customer_reviews.author: Doc P

customer_reviews.title: Too big for women to use safely
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are man-sized. They're so huge that it would actually be dangerous for a woman with smaller hands to use them to handle hot items, with all that loose plastic flopping at the end of each finger. It's great that domestic cooking is no longer considered solely women's work, but we DO cook, and these gloves need to come in a size designed for women. Especially where safety is concerned, it is not true that women can be expected to make do with something designed for men.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to sling meat around in my electric smoker. Handling a hot, smoked turkey is a booger with tongs and spatulas. I've ruined a few hand towels and dish towels improvising. These gloves fit the bill well. The plus is that they're awesome BBQ gloves, too. I wouldn't grab the hot grill with them, but picking up skewers is a snap. They're nicely heat resistant and very easy to clean. In fact, it you wear them while cleaning up a few dishes, the gloves clean themselves. Just sayin'...
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wilson

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an executive chef at a downtown Nashville restaurant. I have used these EVERY day since they've arrived. Best $18 I have ever spent in my life! I can pull things out of our ovens at 450 degrees plus, hold the pans and barely feel a thing. Pulling meats off of our smoker, nada! Shredding and deboning the hot ass meats... NOTHING! The only complaint I would have (it's barely a complaint) is that the inside of the gloves are white and have a cotton feel to them. I can foresee that part getting dingy, and it does make your hands a little sweaty if worn for and extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: Beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: So I was skeptical when I first received these gloves because I didn’t think they would stand up to the heat. I thought they would melt. Well, I was wrong. I have a smoker, and I use a cast iron skillet for my wood chips...right over the flame. So, you have to remove the skillet to add wood to the smoker...once again, very hot skillet. I am amazed that with these gloves, I don’t feel a bit of heat from that skillet through the glove. I’m beyond satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JPCC

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - wish it came in a smaller size
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a nice product. Have only used them once to take a hot casserole out of the oven. The maneuverability is somewhat cumbersome as the gloves are bulky. They don't fit my hands tightly at all and I wish they did. They seem to be made for a larger male hand. But the craftsmanship seems fine. I like the glove feature as opposed to the mitts, just wish my hands weren't swimming around in them. Will update when I have the chance to use them while grilling and will test to see if they are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to shred anything you grill!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for husband who loves to grill. We had bear claws to help shred the meat but his hands would get so hot. I wanted to get these gloves so he could use his hands and hopefully help keep the heat away. They were spot on! He really likes them and by using his hands can shred anything he cooks on the grill. Clean up is easy. Also protects his hands when adding charcoal to the grill from his charcoal chimney. No ashes coming up to singe his hands or arms.
customer_reviews.author: SelL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cooking, bbqing, and homebrewing. So, I've been testing out new gloves to see whats good out there. And this is where the test stops because I feel these are the best. Comfortable interior that's tight and soft. Thick, but easy to maneuver. No stiff fingers or body. Covers the wrist area. Had some nice heat sinks on the hands that also act as good grips too. And I don't feel any heat at all. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: VERY Short Fingers
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty large hands and fairly long and narrow fingers. The fingers in these gloves are so short that they literally only came down to my second knuckle. Furthermore they felt tight on my fingers; and I do NOT have fat fingers. Even my wife found that they did not go to the crotch of her fingers. Result; very uncomfortable and terrible dexterity. Heat resistance was good and they are certainly easy to clean. However, unless you have very short fingers they will not fit well. Not Recommended
customer_reviews.author: KenAZ

customer_reviews.title: Small cuff and liner does shift
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are good. Only giving 4 stars due to the cuff is kind of small and one day when removing the glove the liner shifted. It was kind of a pain to get back into the glove. I’m just mindful now oh how I remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for grilling
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for grilling and cleaning my cast iron pans while they are still hot and these gloves are more that adequate for that job. The one negative thing about them is say is I am a 6'4" man and the fingers on the glove are a slightly too short and narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for skewers
customer_reviews.text: I grill a lot and these are great for flipping and retrieving skewers from the grill top. Normal oven mitts don't have the same precision as these with the individual fingers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are water resistant and come up nice and high
customer_reviews.text: These things look VERY over the top. People always comment that I'm going into battle when I throw these on. But hey, they work! I was tired of spilling hot liquid on our cloth mittens and getting burned by the steam, or hitting my wrists against the oven frame/door. These are water resistant and come up nice and high, meaning I can focus on other stuff when I'm cooking and not worry about burning myself.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a gift for my dad for Christmas. He loves to grill, but we use a charcoal grill (because you can't compete with that flavor). He'll have to add charcoal while grilling, so these gloves allow him to safely remove the rack of food while someone else drops in charcoal. He loves them. He can hold the metal rack he pulls out easily and doesn't feel any heat through the gloves. Perfect gift for him and for us!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Wise

customer_reviews.title: Good but not Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Very comfortable. Gloves are ambidextrous. Each one will go either hand. Only complaint, and it is sort of a serious one, is a lack of strong heat resistance. When reaching over a hot charcoal or propane grill the heat can suddenly penetrate the glove to your hands and get very uncomfortable, very fast. I still like them and use them but you have to be careful. And don't let the inside get wet or damp. It makes the heat transfer worse.
customer_reviews.author: francis kingzett

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling hot liquids, flexible
customer_reviews.text: I got these when they were heavily discounted. I wanted some nice water and heat resistant gloves to prevent hot water soaking through. I took a chance and was greatly rewarded. These hold back a lot of heat but are thin and flexible. The cuffs are perfect length to protect forearms from touching oven racks or sides. Saved my hands many times and are my go to mitts.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lapha

customer_reviews.title: Finger length for large hands.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and have only tried on and not used. First issue I have is that the glove fingers are not long enough for my large hands. The glove joint between finger only extends to my fingers second joint and not back to the knuckle joint/web. Makes figure dexterity somewhat difficult for me. My wife tried and her smaller hand/fingers were okay. If you have large hands just take this into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Nitro7131

customer_reviews.title: Well made, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These work well for hot pans on the stove and hot trays in the oven. The gloves are very flexible and the fingers move individually so you can easily grip things. Since they're silicone, they're also easy to wash off if they get dirty. Although lined with cloth inside the silicone, they are a little on the thin side, so I wouldn't hold hot items for a super long time as the heat will eventually seep inside and get uncomfortable warm/hot. These work just fine for normal usage though.
customer_reviews.author: Noriko

customer_reviews.title: A BIT on the small side but great in every other way
customer_reviews.text: I needed something I could use to take large pieces of meat (pork shoulder, brisket, racks of rins) out of the smoker. When these went on sale, I took the plunge. I have normal-sized hands for someone 6'1 & the fingers in these are a touch short. That said, for the brief amout of time I need them to be on they'regreat! The insulaion they provide is superb, they cover your wrists (which is great), & they're super easy to clean. They're a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Cee C

customer_reviews.title: No heat resistence
customer_reviews.text: Used the gloves to take off a pizza stone (with handles) from the BBQ. Only had the BBQ at 400 degrees. Could barely hold the stone long enough to get it off the grill. Almost burned myself trying to get it in the house. There was no heat protection. Do not buy this product. It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi C

customer_reviews.title: Size is on the small side
customer_reviews.text: I love the grill glove because it really keeps my hand safe from hot pots, steak and handling big turkey. But one thing i do not like this gloves are the finger tips, they are short and the size are on the small side, i use medium gloves and sometime large depending on the maker of the gloves. That is why i give a 5 stars for heat resistance and 4 stars for maneuverability. I hope they do improve their product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.G

customer_reviews.title: They protect from heat, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are ok. Basically, they are like an oven mitt with little fingers. I have average size hands and the gloves fit very small. The fingers are too short and there is absolutely no dexterity. They do protect against heat, but that's about it. Based on the reviews, I thought they allow me to move my fingers a bit easier, but since I can't even get my fingers all the way in the finger pockets, that's impossible. I do like the color.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good bbq gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur bbq enthusiast, & I would recommend these gloves if you're looking for an all-purpose heat resistant glove. I have used a couple of different silicone gloves, but they are always allot bigger than my hand, & I have decently sized hands. These gloves have a cloth liner which makes them fit much better. My only issue is cleanup can be a little difficult as the liner isn't removable, but that hasn't presented a problem so far. In closing if you like to bbq, grill, or are just looking for a decent pair of heat resistant gloves, I'd give these a try
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Protection and Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift and also had the opportunity to use them. Not only did I wear them while cooking food on a very large outdoor grill, I also had to move hot food from the grill to a kitchen about 20 yards away. My hands never felt the heat. Cleaning was easy--While wearing the gloves I put on some hand soap, scrubbed a bit, and Voila! Clean.
customer_reviews.author: J Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Won't last of it gets heated.
customer_reviews.text: The silicone part is really great and I could pickup my cast iron skillet from 500 degree F oven with ease. Problem is the fabric part of the glove can't attend least amount of heat. I used to keep my silicone gloves in the oven for storage. But as you can see after keeping these gloves in the oven ( after I had baked and turned the oven off) but they just don't last.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Worm

customer_reviews.title: was sceptical till I tried them
customer_reviews.text: I love these. if you are working around hot things these are what you need. do not think I would use them for welding temps but cooking temps are what these were made for. you can use it to hold hot meat as you cut it up, not cut proof so do not cut them with your knife, and pans of boiling water, etc. I have small hands and do not think these would work with someone that has really big hands. They might stretch over time but right out of the box they would be tight.
customer_reviews.author: Karol W

customer_reviews.title: Great glove that's comfortable and a good to use
customer_reviews.text: It's excellent and comfortable. Better than cotton material. The outside is silicon which doesn't heat up easily and the inside is some type of fabric that makes it comfortable and easier to grip things. I would recommend over just a pure silicone glove
customer_reviews.author: Your Boss's Boss

customer_reviews.title: Liner improves gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really like the new version of these gloves. I bought these gloves without the liner 4 years ago. I had to replace them because they developed a crack between the thumb and forefinger. The new gloves are much less stiff. It is a lot easier to grab stuff. The new gloves are better protection from heat. I noticed my old gloves would get hot it I held onto something too long.
customer_reviews.author: I. R Yumori

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky, but with fingers in it still easier to use than a mitten style
customer_reviews.text: These are sized more for men than women, so expect the fingers to be a bit long. Still, I had originally bought a mitten style silicone glove, which is less easy to use; so by comparison these are great. None of the silicone mitts, or gloves, are as easy to use at pot holders, but they do protect your hands from high heat. I will give away the mitten style pair and keep these instead.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: these are fun and easy to use and they do actually wash off with a soapy sponge but I do see a residue on them every now and then and have to wonder what happened. Might be soapy water that didn't fully rinse off and later heated up or might be food I didn't realize was there and later heated up in the next use. Other than that residue occasionally popping up without warning I have had zero issues with these and find them easy to use because they're gloves not mittens. Glad I purchased and highly recommend to anyone looking for a grill or oven mitt.
customer_reviews.author: S. Yoffa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everything cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Every year I work a charity turkey cook for Thanksgiving. This year I used these gloves and they work great. Grabbing whole turkey's from 2 large smokers with just the gloves for a week straight worked fantastic. So much that I bought 4 more pair for the rest of the crew to use for next year. I've also used them regularly at home for a variety of different cooks. If I had one complaint it's that they are a little delicate. They are thin and could get punctured if not mindful of that. The thinness does allow for the great flexibility though.
customer_reviews.author: A Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit on larger hands
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product is nice. Flexible and good heat resistance. However they are a bit small for my hands. I can still use them just fine, but be warned unless you have small hands they may be a little tight.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper1

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used them last night for the first time. Protected my hands and arms from the heat of the grill, so much better cooking now. The rubber is easy to grip tongs and spatula. Very easy to clean the outside of the glove. As noted in another review, the inside lining is white, so it will show stains after time, but very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robin O. Gagne

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Really like these gloves. They provide plenty of heat resistance and are very maneuverable. Only dislike is that when washed, they take a very long time to dry. You can't just leave them to sit as the rubber material retains water when against any non-porous surface, like a countertop. Overall, I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good Feel on Hands, Great Grip
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are awesome! Good feel on your hands when wearing them, the oversized gloves aren’t difficult to work with either. I used them taking a pan out of the oven last night and didn’t even feel a hint of heat on my hands. I can’t wait to use them this summer when BBQing, part of the reason I bought them. Product arrived on time, packaging was good, pretty standard. Ive only used them once, but I’d recommend them to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Great product with superior customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves with great customer service after the sale. First set had issues with heated liquid penetrating the heat resistant fabric. One conversation with customer service and a replacement set arrived very quickly! No problems since. They pliable, have used with temps to 350 so far and have no complaints. I would buy from again based on customer service👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work great. The ease of cleaning is a product of what makes the gloves useful and that is the little bumps that allow you to easily grip the meat. I would not refer to this as anything negative just something to be aware of that the last ones I had in yellow were easier to see what wasn’t clean
customer_reviews.author: Calf Creek Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy
customer_reviews.text: Heat resistance is off the chart, but I feel very clumsy when wearing these gloves. I can't confidently handle a brisket when moving it off the grill. The silicone surface doesn't provide good grip or dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great insulation
customer_reviews.text: I use these for baking bread in a cast iron Dutch oven preheated to 500 degrees. I have used these for 3 years and have never been burned. I just bought a pair for my son who has started baking bread since we were ordered to shelter in place 3 weeks ago. Another big plus: colorful and large, little kids love to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: PJR

customer_reviews.title: Like,  but hate. Therefore,  just okay.
customer_reviews.text: I just wished, companies would realize that different sizes would be helpful for smaller, petite people. When something such as this, is being used for hot items; size is so important.
customer_reviews.author: Sab

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my hands
customer_reviews.text: I sprint a lot of time reading reviews for these and other mitts. I have what I would call typical man’s hands not small not big and these fit me ferret. The liner seems good they are comfortable, fit me like a glove and allow my hands complete maneuverability. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: User54

customer_reviews.title: Didn't burn my hands yet with these gloves on
customer_reviews.text: Used them a few times to clean the grill while the coals were hot and they get a little warm but not to the point where you have to stop and take them off. They are big!! Not form fitting. you can hold a frok or grabbers no problem, lift up a grate or place it down.
customer_reviews.author: photofpd

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Very handy item to have around the grill. Maybe a touch clumsy, but not doing brain surgery out there. These gloves certainly keep the heat away from the hands and allow you to do things like lifting the upper grill grate without stopping for a tool, just reach in and lift. Super easy to clean, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Florom

customer_reviews.title: Practical for kamado grill use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves to use with our kamado grill and have not been disappointed. The heat resistance is excellent, although heat in the range of 500F and above the gloves do get warm. I have used these to pick up cooked chunks of meat like brisket and pork butt and they clean up very easily. Overall I am very happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Inside liner is 2x smaller than the size of the outer portion of the glove
customer_reviews.text: I wear XL gloves normally but the liner inside the glove prevents me from actually moving my fingers once i put the glove one. It does great against the fire pit heat. so no i just use the glove as a hand towel to grab hot plates since you can pick up anything with the fingers
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are indeed heat resistant, but they are incredible hard to use. They get very slippery when wet from handling meat. Hard to handle meat and grill temp probes to the point of being useless to me...They also run large. The L size I bought are more like XL or more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Great Barbecue Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These work great as barbecue gloves. The heat resistance is amazing. I can grab hot coals and logs and move them around in my firebox with ease. Only knock is they’re a bit small for me... but I have freakish dinner plate size hands. I’m sure they’ll fit most people just fine. I make do.
customer_reviews.author: abe530

customer_reviews.title: Little big, but will do the job
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I read they run small. I have a smaller hand about 8" from Thumb to pinky stretched out. They are still a bit big on me but they work. I really wish they made these in sizes but this type seemed to be the best on Amazon for the money
customer_reviews.author: DB7

customer_reviews.title: Best oven mitts I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that these gloves are both textured and waterproof. I've had some good oven mitts, but let's face it, any kind of cloth is subject to hot juices burning you anyway. These are also longer., protecting more of your arm. I am absolutely thrilled with them and would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gloves for Cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Had to get replacement gloves for use in the kitchen after my KithenAid ones starting tearing and nearly burning my hands when grabbing baking sheets from the oven. These gloves work wonderfully! Comfortable and protective. As well, unlike my previous gloves, you can use either glove on either hand! This means that two right-handed cooks can be wearing a glove at the same time for working together in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These felt a bit cumbersome when I first put them on. Inside feels like a good fit, but overall, they seem large. But they get the job done and work well. I've handled a grill grate and also cast iron skillet without feeling hot, so the heat resistance seems good so far.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING BBQ HEAT GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed and happy with this product!!! The bbq heat gloves fit real good and I feel no heat when I use them. I bought 2 pairs and gave one set to my son, who loves them too. I highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Skiles

customer_reviews.title: When I first opened the package I thought "What the hell?!"  They I used em.  AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: So, while these things look HUGE, once you put em on and use em, you are on happy person. I have several sets of cloth (and some very spendy nice looking ones from WS) but these are by far the BEST! I have no worries whatsoever that I'm gonna get burned, unlike cloth ones. Even though they look enormous, my hands and arms are safe. And that's what counts:)
customer_reviews.author: bluetear

customer_reviews.title: great heat resistance gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to take my cast iron dutch oven out of the oven when I make my artisan bread in a 450 degree oven. They work well and fit my husband also so he can use them when grilling. It will be a few months before we can test them out while grilling however. We live in Wisconsin where it is snowing - expecting 12+ inches with -30 degree wind chills.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable gloves
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves to replace several pairs I've had for almost 20 years. I am very impressed! I was able to reach into my oven with ease and not worry about being scalded or burnt. They are very comfortable and I love having fingers instead of mitts. Makes it easier to grab plates and use utensils on the grill. Gloves are a great value and appear very durable.
customer_reviews.author: halah

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and just buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, these gloves are awesome! We smoke meat and always need something heat resistant to get the meat in off the smoker. These gloves are THE BEST! We can carry the brisket or the turkey off the grill to the pan without any burns. Just can’t recommend these enough. Just buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Bee Beeing Bizzee

customer_reviews.title: Do not get them wet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Says waterproof, but once water touched the cloth portion of the glove; the cloth portion shrunk and the gloves no longer fit. Such a disappointment, before water touched the cloth, the gloves worked great. Now once shrunken, they no longer fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. The liner was bound up so I couldn't get all my fingers into each finger of the glove, but that was quickly resolved and I learned something useful in the event I need to wash the gloves. An "off prescription use" - I even found them easier to use in the kitchen than a pot holder because the provide a better grip and more flexibility
customer_reviews.author: Allhooligan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for those who have long fingers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add to some other bbq gloves that I use for handling actual fire (wood logs and charcoal). These gloves are great, but the fingers aren’t long enough for my hands (I am 6”2, so may not be a problem for many). If you are working with tongs, there’s a bit of resistance in the glove, but that might be because the gloves are a poor fit for me. They are easy to wash and great for handling meat directly off the grill. Would recommend for smaller hands!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great, if they fit your hand
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for the wife (5’3”), not so great for the husband (6’3”). When I wear them, the fingers are WAY too short to be useful. They do an awesome job with hot objects, they are just a one size fits most elf sized creatures and child sized individuals.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fine for lifting something out of the oven. Not good for grilling. Too small.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were too small and the thumb, being flat in-line with the fingers, makes it too difficult to hold and maneuver grilling tongs. Good for lifting a pan out of an oven. Note: my wife bought a pair of a different brand name. They appear to be identical but without the brand name on the glove, unlike the image on Amazon. I paid $19.88 for mine. She paid $11.95 for hers.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Not just for grilling
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are fantastic! My family doesn’t use theses just for grilling, you don’t feel heat through the gloves at all and the rubber texture is wonderful for gripping things when taking them from the oven. I had another set of gloves like this from a different company and I can say this one is so much better! I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri K

customer_reviews.title: Item returned
customer_reviews.text: Item retrned. Perhaps better for a guy not for a woman size 6 glove. Also seemed thick and inflexible
customer_reviews.author: storyteller312

customer_reviews.title: Easier to grip bowls in small oven
customer_reviews.text: These make it sooo much easier to get things out of our toaster oven. Before this, we were using an oven mitten, but with the tight space of a countertop oven it was hard to grip bowls. These solve that... and seem more heat resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BBQ gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gloves. I like that they are silicone and very heat resistant. I’ve had rubber bbq gloves melt if they hit the grill grate or smoker flame area but these shouldn’t do that. Nice high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gsh923

customer_reviews.title: Grilling gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for grilling and to use for the oven. For the oven use, they are a bit bulky but they protect the hand and a lot of the arm. Once it gets warm, looking to use on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Red Devil

customer_reviews.title: Good for about five mins
customer_reviews.text: The first day I got them tore a hole in them like nothing. Cheapest silicone ever. I guess that's why they don't sell them anymore. Oh well, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: BC1997

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use over a camping fire this summer, and they were definitely the best camping purchase made in a long while. They work well for moving logs around a dying fire, for shifting cast iron skillets over a griddle, and for picking up a cooking grate after a meal is over. I have yet to experience any burns or discomfort over a heat source in these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Grill Gloves that Work
customer_reviews.text: I don't feel the heat coming through when I grab my cast iron skillet, or if I want to turn corn on the cob. They go up about mid-arm, which means if I bump up against anything I feel protected.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Enormous!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are just huge!!! While they may be effective and heat resistant, I'd have to build an addition onto the kitchen to store them. If Sasquatch decides to get into grilling, have I got a product for him!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline K. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Hands Safe and No Burns
customer_reviews.text: I grill a lot. I do lots of kabobs and am always turning them over, these gloves make it very easy to reach into the heat and do what you gotta do. They can be a tad clumsy, but overall a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Roger G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small-ish, a little firm as well
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the most flexible gloves in the world - but I suppose that's a trade off for not burning your fingers away. They run a touch small for my larger hands/arms, but they get the job done. Worth the price - though I'd might look for something bigger for myself if I ever have to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Things to know
customer_reviews.text: Works well, fingers are a little tight since the length is short. If I buy another one, I will bump up to a XL size. Also sometimes it is hard to grip things so use more finess and slower and careful handling of hot things. Other than the fit and the sometimes awkward feel, the heat eesistance works great and they are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kola Champagne

customer_reviews.title: Does not handle heat!!!
customer_reviews.text: From using with a charcoal bbq at least once a week, the fabric part started flacking off. And no it didn’t get burnt in any way, just purely from using over the heat. This evening while have these gloves on I couldn’t handle the heat while using the charcoal chimney. I can not recommend these. It’s a shame they are outside the return period because I’ll be trashing these.
customer_reviews.author: Andre S.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, don't purchase, no good for grilling
customer_reviews.text: I got a size large and it barely fit my small hands, let alone my husband's. Then when he went to grill they didn't stop the heat from getting to my husband's hands. They didn't serve their purpose, they weren't comfortable, and they aren't any good for grilling. Total waste of money. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gillin

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: I would not stick my hand in a fire but for working around the grill they do what they advertise and are easy to put on and off. I wear and XL glove and these come right off so if I do catch them on fire I will not have to jump in the pool
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice addition to the kitchen, reasonably good dexterity and good grip. But the best is they are waterproof (and steam proof)!!! Great for grabbing things where there is risk of splashing, or wet objects. Wife uses them to hold spaghetti squash while scraping out the insides...can't do that with an Ove Glove! I use them when brewing to remove/hold grain steeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ferrand

customer_reviews.title: Improves safety, confidence, & efficiency.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift, so I cannot speak to the specifics, however I can say that the recipient loves them & it has replaced their old method of hand towels. I see that it makes one more confident to handle hot sheet and hotel pans. This is a safety product and it makes me happy to upgrade my colleagues. I feel like I've improved their lives. A+ product, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Feel invincible in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I finally pulled the trigger on some of these and stopped burning myself grabbing things on the grill and in the oven. I even have started buying these for friends since they've made such an impact on me. The old way of using a towel or a clunky oven mitt without fingers seems absurd.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pathuis

customer_reviews.title: Have not used it for the reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Requested Red, got orange. Gloves are comfortable to wear, not too bulky. Opens jars pretty well. Have not tried it with very, very hot items from oven. I would like to try to handle grilled oysters with gloves...but that doesn't seem likely this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Belle Blackmar

customer_reviews.title: I love 'em.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I can grab things right off a hot grill, including the grill grate! I can easily hold a hot rack of ribs while I cut them and I can feel no heat. The fingers are a little short but that's good in this case because you don't have glove fingertips in the way when carving meat. I'm sorry I didn't order them sooner. They're a great tool in the grilling arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: marcus d spartan

customer_reviews.title: Can still use hands easily!
customer_reviews.text: These work really great and are super helpful. You can really use your hands while wearing them. I'll use them when frying things too. Ibfeelnthe heat resistance could be better but I am extra sensitive with heat. Over all very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love this glove!!!
customer_reviews.text: I barbecue a lot and needed something comfortable and easy to put on that would protect me at the same time. These are exactly what I was looking for could not be happier. Just love them.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great general use and grip in cleaning a kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Got these for cleaning out the fryer, pulling hood vents, bricking the grill, and for using a heavy duty degreaser that would normally dry and crack and shedd skin off my hands. Does it all with ease
customer_reviews.author: justin davis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous grilling gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grilling gloves both in design, (you can easily use your fingers), and excellent heat resistant quality. My grill hits 650 degrees on a high heat setting, not a problem for these gloves ! A terrific price from Amazon, fast delivery, and a great product..,
customer_reviews.author: Craig Taylor

customer_reviews.title: They're gloves for grilling or whatever.
customer_reviews.text: Fine purchase. A little small on my hands but has already saved me from getting burned. Nice set of gloves, decent value for the money. They are "cotton" lined/padded? which is nice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckba

customer_reviews.title: so much better than traditional oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: I bake, and I've always used the traditional oven mitts to take out the pans and sheets from the oven. The mitts are clumsy but they also allow heat through pretty quickly. I bought the gloves on a whim while looking for a solution and I'm so happy I did! Less clumsy and better at keeping my hands cool.
customer_reviews.author: trsonderm

customer_reviews.title: Very "hand"y
customer_reviews.text: We BBQ or smoke meat quite frequently. I like these for some many reason. Good quality. Good heat resistance. And since they are silicone I can use them to grab the meat off the grill and just wash them like I was washing my hands. Actually bought a pair for a friend since I liked them so much.
customer_reviews.author: EGGYWEST

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves and quality service
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. I Purchased them back in March of this year and recently noticed that one of them had a small tare in the pinky finger. I use these gloves a lot for smoking food and making homebrew beer, when I noticed the whole I contacted GeekHom and by the end of the week they had sent me a replacement. I would highly recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Steckline

customer_reviews.title: Super useful.
customer_reviews.text: And lining is nice! I can use these for anything in the house that's hot including for example the fireplace screen. I bought a few other silicone gloves like this but they're too big. This one is a nice size fit for my hand.
customer_reviews.author: SRS

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned so many different varieties of oven mitts. None of them worked. Finally have a pair that works on everything in the kitchen. From grabbing meats off the smoker, to corn from boiling water, to pots and pans on the stove and to cookie trays from the oven. So happy and yes I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying more for family.
customer_reviews.text: I have sided these on the grill 3x. I didn’t not feel the heat at all. This has made my grilling and turning much easier. I also use them with my air fryer. Best purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimkbs

customer_reviews.title: Grill, oven and airfryer heat protection
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are well made and sturdy, even long enough to help reach into my teardrop shape air fryer to mix contents during cooking. Only negative is that they comparatively large for indoor use, affecting maneuverability there.
customer_reviews.author: PMFog

customer_reviews.title: Real bulky
customer_reviews.text: These are to bulky to use for much , it is even hard to pick up a bbq basket. If you hold on to anything hot for a minute it starts to get hot through the glove. I do not recommend these , I think there are probably better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Marion O. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t gotten to use them yet but they seem well made. The fit is good. It’s to early to give it accurate star ratings. First impressions seem well made and thought out
customer_reviews.author: Jon T.

product_meta.title: GEEKHOM Grilling Gloves, Heat Resistant Gloves BBQ Kitchen Silicone Oven Mitts, Long Waterproof Non-Slip Potholder for Barbecue, Cooking, Baking (Black)
feature_bullets: EXCELLENT HEAT RESISTANCE. The oven mitts is made of BPA Free silicone, heat-resistant from -104℉to 446℉. Environmentally Friendly, security and durable.

DUAL-LAYER DESIGN: This BBQ gloves is designed with an outer silicone glove and inner heat-resistant cotton layer, comfortable and moisture wicking, maximize your heat protection from grill and oven temperatures.

LONG SLEEVE and ROPE DESIGN: This cooking gloves is with a long sleeve to protect your wrist and arm and glove cuff is designed with a rope so that the glove can be hanged on a hook when not in use, easier to store and saves more room for kitchen.
NON-SLIP DESIGN: Texture on the surface of the waterproof gloves provides a NON-SLIP protection, never worry about falling when pick up food or something else.

FULL GEEKHOM WARRANTY - Provides 100% no questions asked money back guarantee. If you’re not completely satisfied with your silicone grill gloves purchase simply let us know, and you'll be offered a FULL refund or replacement! Enjoy this absolutely RISK FREE purchase today by clicking the yellow 'Add to Cart button' above.
